details.title: The first month
details.description: In the first month of pregnancy, it is important for the mother to take special care of her health because it plays a major role in the development of the fetus. Here are the most important tips related to vitamins, exercises, food, and drinking water.

sections.title: Sports exercises
sections.content: Light exercise is permissible provided that the mother is in good health and does not suffer from complications.
recommended: You can do light exercises such as yoga for pregnant women. These activities help improve blood circulation and reduce stress.
Light stretching exercises to relieve stress and improve blood circulation.
avoid: Sports that require jumping or physical contact.
Avoid strenuous exercise or heavy lifting at this stage.

tips.title: 1. Beginners
tips.duration: The duration can be from 15 to 30 minutes.
tips.description: These sessions focus on basic movements and breathing exercises.

tips.title: 2. Intermediate level:
tips.description: The sessions include more challenging exercises with a focus on flexibility and strength.

tips.title: 3. Advanced level:
tips.description: The focus is on complex movements and increasing mental and physical awareness.

tips.title: 4. Short sessions for meditation or relaxation:
tips.duration: These can be from 5 to 15 minutes, ideal during the day to relieve stress.
tips.description: If you are starting for the first time, it is recommended to start with a short duration and gradually increase it according to your comfort and ability

sections.title: Vitamins and Supplements
sections.content: Taking the right vitamins and supplements is crucial for fetal development.

items.name: Folic Acid
items.description: It is considered the most important in the first month because it reduces the risk of neural tube defects.

items.name: Vitamin D
items.description: Helps in the absorption of calcium and maintains healthy bones.

items.name: Calcium
items.description: Necessary for the development of bones and teeth.

items.name: Iron
items.description: NNecessary for transporting oxygen and forming additional blood for the fetus.

sections.title: Foods to Eat
sections.content: Such as spinach, broccoli, lentils, and citrus fruits, because folic acid is essential for the development of the fetus's nervous system.
avoid: Raw or undercooked foods (such as sushi and uncooked meats).

sections.title: Drink plenty of water
sections.content: To maintain hydration and support fetal growth.
recommended: It is recommended to drink 8-10 glasses a day (about 2-2.5 liters), Water helps to: Prevent dehydration, Support amniotic fluid formation, Improves blood circulation, Reduce or avoid caffeine intake if possible
